result.reason: Printer redirection inconsistency is a known limitation of the Microsoft RDP ActiveX control (MSTSCLib) vs mstsc.exe — mRemoteNG only sets AdvancedSettings2.RedirectPrinters boolean and has no control over which printers the COM component chooses to redirect
result.approach: Cannot fix — the underlying Microsoft RDP ActiveX control handles printer enumeration/redirection internally and does not expose per-printer control. This is a well-known limitation shared by all RDP ActiveX consumers.

attempts.raw_output:
Based on my analysis of issue #1182 and the codebase:

The issue reports that printer redirection in mRemoteNG only forwards some printers (4/8 or 3/8 depending on the server), while `mstsc.exe` correctly redirects all printers. The code at `RdpProtocol.cs:1143` simply sets `_rdpClient.AdvancedSettings2.RedirectPrinters = true/false` — a boolean toggle on the Microsoft RDP ActiveX control. This is a known limitation of the `MSTSCLib` ActiveX control vs. the full `mstsc.exe` client; mRemoteNG has no granular control over which printers get redirected. The inconsistency is in Microsoft's COM component behavior, not in mRemoteNG's code.

This is a well-known limitation shared by all RDP ActiveX consumers."}
